author: hmijail
content: But if the chunk is 4 bytes , you wouldn’t need 1 byte of offset. So you first need to decide the bulk of the data. And anyway maybe it’d make sense to send that information in another way - for example, maybe a list of invalid JUMPDESTS, since those should be rare and such a list would compress better? No idea, just a wild thought

author: hmijail
content: also, worth mentioning: In the range 9M-10M there are lots of cases of >150K segments (basic blocks) per block; the maximum I've seen is >190K. Adding 1 byte of offset per segment, no matter the chunk size, would therefore be a lot of overhead for the (probably!) rare case of invalid JUMPDESTs.
